newsitem.title: FRANCE: Michelin extends rally after H1 results.
newsitem.headline: Michelin extends rally after H1 results.

text.p: Shares in Michelin were 2.85 percent higher in early trading on Tuesday after the tyremaker reported a jump in first-half profit excluding exceptionals.
"They were very good figures. Brokers are upgrading, and the message is very positive," a trader said.
Michelin said first-half profit excluding taxes and exceptional charges increased around 50 percent to 2.88 billion francs.
Its net profit fell to 1.35 billion francs in the first half from 1.51 billion after Michelin took a 709 million franc charge to restructure its Spanish subsidiary Neumaticos Michelin.

Finance director Eric Bourdais de Charbonniere told a news conference the company did not dispute analysts' forecasts, compiled before the results and charge were announced, for a full year profit between three and 3.5 billion francs.
He said the forecasts would likely be adjusted to reflect the charge.
Michelin shares were up 7.40 francs, or 2.85 percent, at 267.50 at 0900 GMT after gaining 2.24 percent on Monday on expectations of good results.
The bourse's CAC-40 index was down 0.2 percent.
